info.title: Actual HTTP Api
info.summary: Basic Actual Budget API exposed through HTTP endpoints
info.description:
This HTTP api is a wrapper of the Actual Budget api for NodeJS, see its documentation [here](https://actualbudget.org/docs/api/reference)

Amount/currency values:
In the context of this api, a currency amount is an integer representing the value without any decimal places.
Usually it’s value * 100, but it depends on your currency. For example, a USD amount of $120.30 would be 12030.

budgetSyncId.name: budgetSyncId
budgetSyncId.description: This is the Synchronization ID from Actual Budget → Settings → Show advanced settings → Sync ID

budgetEncryptionPassword.name: budget-encryption-password
budgetEncryptionPassword.description: Optional encryption password for end-to-end encrypted budgets. Only needed in the first interaction with the encrypted budget, subsequent requests don't need to provide this value

page.name: page
page.description: Page number. When limit is set, this parameter is required. Example 2

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Number of transactions to return. When page is set, this parameter is required. Example 50

items.description: An array of categories in this group. Not valid when creating or updating a category group. Only available in a get.

payee_name.description: Only available in a create request

subtransactions.description: Only available in a get or create request

examples.error: Error accessing Actual Server, check Actual Server url

get.summary: Returns list of accounts for the budget associated with the sync id specified

200.description: The list of accounts for the specified budget

put.description:
transferAccountId and transferCategoryId are optional if the balance of the account is 0, otherwise if the account has a non-zero balance, you need to specify an account with transferAccountId to transfer the money into.
If you are transferring from an on-budget account to an off-budget account, you can optionally specify a category with transferCategoryId to categorize the transfer transaction.

post.summary: Triggers a bank sync for a specific account

get.summary: Returns list of months for the budget associated with the sync id specified

200.description: The list of months for the specified budget

get.summary: Returns the budget information for the month specified
Returns the list of categories for the month specified

200.description: List of categories for the month specified

get.summary: Returns the category information for the month specified

200.description: Category information for the month specified

patch.summary: Updates the category information for the month specified

200.description: Category information updated for the month specified

get.summary: Returns the list of category groups for the month specified

200.description: List of category groups for the month specified

get.summary: Returns the category group information for the month specified

200.description: Category group information for the month specified

post.description:
Moves money from one category to another for one specific month.
If the source category is not specified the money will come from available to budget.
If the destination is not specified the money will go to available to budget.

post.summary: Put a budget amount on hold for next month
post.description: Put a budget amount on hold for next month

200.description: Budget amount was put on hold for next month

examples.message: Budget amount 10000 was put on hold for next month

get.summary: Returns list of rules for a payee

200.description: The list of rules for a payee

get.summary: Returns list of rules for the budget associated with the sync id specified

200.description: The list of rules for the specified budget

get.summary: Returns list of transactions for an account

200.description: The list of transactions for an account

post.description: Actual Budget api says the addTransactions functionality returns a list of ids for the transactions created, but that is not the case, it simply returns the string message 'ok'
Actual Budget api says the addTransactions functionality returns a list of ids for the transactions created, but that is not the case, it simply returns the string message 'ok'

201.description: Ids of transactions add and updated
